title: failed to convert GOTPCREL relocation against std::panicking::PANIC_COUNT: relink with --no-relax

labels.name: A-linkage
labels.description: Area: linking into static, shared libraries and binaries

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
I have a medium sized project using WGPU and if one single function is added rustc fails to link If this function is commented out, everything works just fine. The code of the function that causes the problem: ```rust pub fn update(&self, queue: &wgpu::Queue) { queue.write_texture( wgpu::ImageCopyTexture { texture: &self.voxel_texture, mip_level: 1, origin: wgpu::Origin3d { x: 0, y: 0, z: 0 }, aspect: wgpu::TextureAspect::All, }, &[0; (VOXEL_DIMENSION * VOXEL_DIMENSION * VOXEL_DIMENSION) as usize * 4 * 4], wgpu::ImageDataLayout { offset: 0, bytes_per_row: NonZeroU32::new(VOXEL_DIMENSION * 4 * 4), rows_per_image: NonZeroU32::new(VOXEL_DIMENSION), }, wgpu::Extent3d { width: VOXEL_DIMENSION, height: VOXEL_DIMENSION, depth_or_array_layers: VOXEL_DIMENSION, }, ) } ``` If I comment out the line, where this function get called everything works fine, even if the source of the function persists. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.68.0 (2c8cc3432 2023-03-06) binary: rustc commit-hash: 2c8cc343237b8f7d5a3c3703e3a87f2eb2c54a74 commit-date: 2023-03-06 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.68.0 LLVM version: 15.0.6 ``` I also tried the nightly version: ``` rustc 1.70.0-nightly (39f2657d1 2023-03-09) binary: rustc commit-hash: 39f2657d1101b50f9b71ae460b762d330cc8426b commit-date: 2023-03-09 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.70.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.7 ``` and both `linux-gnu` and `linux-musl` targets on both versions.
Backtrace
